Support

Welcome to the GSMA Mobile Money API Developer Portal

The Mobile Money API is an initiative developed through collaboration between the mobile money industry and the GSMA, which provides a harmonized API Specification for all the common mobile money use cases which is both easy to use and secure.
Learn more Go to API Docs

# What you’ll get

The developer portal provides a central hub of useful information for the mobile money industry to support the creation and use of Mobile Money APIs, for both business and developer users.

Business Information

Guidance for business and product owners on how the Mobile Money API can support the mobile money industry for specific use cases across multiple industry verticals.

  • Industry use cases
  • Case studies
  • Testimonials

Developer Documentation

A full set of developer documentation and guides for getting started with the Mobile Money API Specification.

  • API fundamentals
  • Security and API flows
  • API reference docs
  • OAS Open API docs
  • Code snippets
  • API use case guides and sequence flows

Developer Tools

A full suite of tools to facilitate developers analysing, implementing or integrating to the API.

  • Simulator sandbox of example API
  • Example OAuth 2.0 API Gateway
  • Use case scenarios sequences
  • Authenticated Postmans for each scenario

# Benefits and objectives

Using technology best practices in API design and security, the GSMA API aims to simplify and accelerate the advancement of Open APIs in mobile money platforms and stimulate the growth of the ecosystem.

For API providers

  • If you are a mobile money provider implementing the GSMA API, the developer portal will support the rapid creation of new APIs to attract third-party service providers to your platform and grow your ecosystem.

For API consumers

  • If you are a service provider creating solutions for the mobile money ecosystem, the developer portal will support easily creating solutions which support the GSMA API and allow you to scale your integrations across the industry.

# Mobile Money Metrics

Explore the GSMA’s interactive tool that provides a comprehensive set of global metrics by combining unique data sources from the GSMA Mobile Money programme.
Download dataset

# Explore what’s possible

How can the GSMA API support your business? Explore potential use cases for your industry.
Mobile Money Provider
Use the GSMA API to connect with many third party service providers
Learn more
Merchants & Service Providers
Use the GSMA API to accept in-store and online payments from your customers
Learn more
Governments
Use the GSMA API specification to facilitate G2P cash disbursements
Learn more
Humanitarian Agencies
Use the GSMA API to optimise the delivery of cash disbursements
Learn more
International Transfer Organisations
Use the GSMA API to integrate with mobile money wallets and transfer money across international borders
Learn more
Payment Service Providers & Payment Aggregators
Use the GSMA API when working at large scale with multiple APIs using a single connection point
Learn more
Banks & Microfinance Institutions
Use the GSMA API to integrate provision of financial services such as loans and savings to customers with mobile money wallets
Learn more
FinTech Providers (Insurance Savings Loans)
Use the GSMA API to enable customers to pay bills and set up subscriptions for services such as insurance and other digital financial services
Learn more
Employers
Use the GSMA API to distribute salaries to their employees directly via their mobile phones
Learn more
Energy & Utilities & AgriTech
Use the GSMA API to automate processing of customers’ bill payments
Learn more
Education & Health
Use the GSMA API to simplify acceptance of payments from clients for essential services
Learn more
Mobile Money Agents
Use the GSMA API to provide services registration of new accounts and cash-in and cash-out from their account
Learn more

# Explore use cases

How can the GSMA API support common mobile money use cases? Explore the use cases relevant for your business.
Merchant payments

Enables merchants to accept payments from mobile money customers via payee-initiated, payer-initiated and pre-authorised merchant payments

Disbursements

Enables organisations to disburse funds to mobile money recipients via individual and bulk transfers

International transfers

Enables financial service providers to perform cross-border mobile money transfers, including remittances

P2P transfers

Enables financial service providers to transfer funds between domestic mobile money account holders or to other recipients

Recurring payments

Enables service providers to setup payment mandates for mobile money customers and initiate payments against mandates

Account linking

Enables providers to link digital financial services accounts to mobile money accounts, allowing customers to transfer funds between accounts

Bill payments

Enables service providers to accept bill payments from mobile money customers

Agent Services

Enables agents to register new accounts and agents or ATM platforms to provide cash-in and cash-out services

# Compliance platform

The GSMA offers a free GSMA Mobile Money API Compliance Verification Service to allow mobile money providers who implement one or more API Specification use cases to verify and market their platforms as GSMA Mobile Money API compliant. The compliance platform is also freely available for providers for development and testing purposes. Please request access by registering or contacting support.mmapi@gsma.com.

# Collaboration platform

The GSMA has created an online GSMA Mobile Money API Community which is available to all members of the mobile money ecosystem who are interested in collaborating on common APIs. The platform is used alongside GSMA API Working Groups to advance the specification and brings together different stakeholders in an open environment. Here the GSMA will publish API and guidelines proposals, RFCs and beta specifications for requirements raised in the working groups for review by the industry. Please request access by registering or contacting support.mmapi@gsma.com.

# Other Developer Resources

# SDKs

Access pre-built SDKs which provide a full set of tools, libraries, documentation and code samples which help integrate GSMA APIs. SDKs are available in Android, JavaScript, Node.js, PHP and Java.

# Security

Security design and implementation guidelines are available to help developers ensure best practice security principles are applied to the connection between the API client and the API gateway for authentication and authorisation of API requests.

# Guidelines

Best practice guidance on how and when to use the three supported API request-response flows available in the GSMA specification for API creators, enabling a consistent implementation approach for each flow and simplify implementation.

# FAQs

Explore Frequently Asked Questions about the GSMA Mobile Money API initiative and how the developer portal can help you get started with the API.

# User Dashboard

The GSMA API Gateway is an example authentication gateway which adopts the best practice security recommendations of OAuth 2.0 and is built on the latest AWS API Gateway technology, thus giving providers an easy way to demonstrate how GSMA APIs could work in production with on-boarded service providers.

By registering with the GSMA developer portal, you will get access to a unique user dashboard home with direct access to all the tools required for utilisation of the GSMA API Gateway, sandbox environment and Postman collections with authentication. Portal registration is simple and automated to give developers instant access to their user dashboard to create and view applications for selected products and view your unique API credentials (consumer keys and secrets) required for API access.

Register Now

# Get Started with Development

Get started with the powerful range of easy to use developer tools to work with the Mobile Money API Specification.
Learn more Start developing

# Testimonials

As a payment service provider that is directly integrated with over 35 MNO partners, we understand the importance of Standardised APIs to save time on development work, resources and keeping integrations up to date.

Cellulant

Payment Service Provider

Merchant Payments

International Transfers

P2P transfers

Mobile money is revolutionising the way citizens in our country are making payments. As a government authority, we are benefiting from direct API Integrations with MMPs as they enable users to make fast, efficient and secure payments for government services, while lessening the use of cash.

Uganda Revenue

Authority Government / Government Agency

Disbursements

Bill Payments

P2P transfers

As a platform that offers educational content through mobile money, we appreciate the importance of being integrated with MMPs using APIs. It enables our consumers to easily purchase desired content. As we continue to expand our services and customer base, we hope to have access to a Standard API in the future, which will enable us to reach a wider base of users in remote areas.

Eneza Education

Education Service Provider

P2P Transfers

Recurring Payments

Bill Payments

Our mission is to extend affordable health services to users in remote areas, by using methods that are available to them such as mobile phones. By being integrated with MMPs, customers are able to easily make payments and subscribe to our services. Currently, we are integrated with 5 MMPs, and are looking to expand in the future, hopefully with the aid of a Standard API.

Baobab Circle

Healthcare Service Provider

Bill Payments

Recurring Payments

As a financial service provider operating in a country where the majority of the population have access to banking services through their mobile phones, establishing partnerships and integrating with MMPs has benefited us when extending services to the financially exclude
